newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgium cuts central, end-of-day rates.
newsitem.headline: Belgium cuts central, end-of-day rates.

text.p: The Belgian National Bank on Thursday cut its key central interest rate to 3.00 percent from 3.20 percent, and its end-of-day rate to 4.25 percent from 4.45.
The Belgian rate changes came after the Bundesbank sliced 30 basis point of its repo rate, taking it to 3.00 percent.

The central rate applies to overnight lending for primary dealers of government debt, the end-of-day rate to overnight lending for all others. Financial institutions can only draw funds at these rates up to fixed amounts.
The emergency lending rate was left unchanged at 6.00 percent. The discount rate stands at 2.50 percent.
The emergency lending rate applies to overnight funds without volume limits for all financial institutions. It is roughly equivalent to the Bundesbank's Lombard rate.
